page.title: 07BUILDINGS 1
page.content: Pre 1700 The main structural elements of all the most historically important buildings belong to the pre-1700 period and include the Castle and Stables, St. George's Church and the Prior's House, the Dovecote and the Barn, the Nunnery in Church Street which probably dates from the 15th century, the Yarn Market in the High Street built about 1589 and repaired in 1647, the Luttrell Arms, built in 1500 as a home for the Cistercian Abbots of nearby Cleeve but altered in the early 17th century to form an inn, the Old Manor (Lower Marsh Farm) which dates from the 15th century with alterations in the 18th century and the Gallox Bridge.
